title: 3 Arrested, Another Detained Over Bengal Gang Rape Horror
content: A case has been filed against the accused under sections for gangrape and criminal liability when multiple people act with a common intention.

title: "How Was She Out At 12.30 am?" Mamata Banerjee's Shocker After Gang Rape
content: In shocking remarks in the aftermath of an MBBS student's gangrape in West Bengal's Durgapur, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has tried to shift the responsibility of students' security to private colleges

title: Video: Helicopter Spins In Air, Crashes Into Trees At California Beach, 5 Injured
content: The wrecked aircraft got tangled and dangled from several palm trees near the Pacific Coast Highway, authorities said.

title: 'Should Speak Mindfully': P Chidambaram's Op Blue Star Remark Irks Congress
content: The Congress leadership is upset with senior party leader and former Union Home Minister P Chidambaram for his remarks on the Indira Gandhi government's handling of Operation Blue Star, sources in the party have said

title: Bengal Gang Rape Survivor's Friend, Who Fled, Under Scanner: Women's Body
content: A friend of a 23-year-old Odisha college student, who was allegedly gang-raped by unidentified men near her institute in West Bengal's Durgapur, is also under the scanner and the police must consider interrogating him, the women's body has said.

title: Inside Trump's 'Dead Cat Diplomacy' In Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Push
content: Donald Trump has been equally expedient in laying dead cats at Hamass doorstep. First, by ironing out his peace plan with Israel while excluding Hamas from the process, and then by turning to his TruthSocial platform to single out Hamas

title: 20 Kg Gold Biscuits Worth Rs 2.82 Crore Seized At India-Bangladesh Border
content: Border Security Force (BSF) jawans apprehended a smuggler near the India-Bangladesh border in West Bengal's Nadia district and seized 20 kg gold biscuits from his possession, a statement issued by the paramilitary force said.

title: "No Compromise On Pakistan's Defence": Shehbaz Sharif On Afghan 'Provocations'
content: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said on Sunday he "strongly condemns provocations" by Afghanistan, vowing a "strong and effective response" after border clashes between the neighbouring countries overnight.

title: "Don't Want Her To Stay In Bengal": Father Of Durgapur Gang Rape Survivor
content: The father of the MBBS student from Odisha, who was gangraped in West Bengal's Durgapur, has said he will be taking his daughter back to Odisha and that he is concerned about her safety in Bengal.

title: "58 Pak Soldiers Killed": Taliban's Big Claim And A Warning After Strikes
content: Taliban spokesperson Zabeehullah Mujahid on Sunday urged Islamabad to expel the ISIS terrorists "hiding on their soil" as they retaliated to Pakistani airstrikes in Afghan territory.

title: Israeli Man Sets Self On Fire, Dies. His Girlfriend Was Killed By Hamas
content: An Israeli man who survived the October 7, 2023, Hamas attack on a music festival in Israel has died by suicide, days after the second anniversary of the attack.

title: Stringent SC/ST Act Invoked In Haryana IPS Officer's Suicide Case
content: Police have added charges to the FIR registered in the alleged suicide case of Haryana IPS officer Y Puran Kumar following a plea by his wife to add the "relevant provisions" of the SC/ST Act.

title: Lucknow Gang Rape Suspect Arrested; Another Shot At, Flees With Injury
content: Police arrested a 20-year-old man in connection with the alleged rape of a minor Dalit student in the Lucknow district, an official said on Sunday.

title: IndiGo Fined Rs 40 Lakh For Using Unqualified Pilot Simulators
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has imposed a total penalty of Rs 40 lakh on IndiGo Airlines after finding that the carrier conducted pilot training on non-qualified flight simulators for operations at critical airports

title: Explosive Found In Abandoned Bag In Meghalaya, Defused By Police
content: A possible terror incident was averted after Meghalaya Police defused an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) found inside an abandoned bag in a residential area in Ri Bhoi district.

title: Trump's Dealmaking Diplomacy Grows Fragile As China Fires Back
content: President Donald Trump's preference to cut one-to-one deals with allies and adversaries has been the hallmark of his self-proclaimed dealmaking magic.

title: MNS Worker Slaps Woman, Forces Her To Apologise For Abusing Her Husband
content: A video of the incident has gone viral on social media in which the MNS worker, identified as Swara Ghate, forced the woman to apologise to the people of Maharashtra.

title: Australian Airline Says Stolen Customer Data Posted Online After Cyberattack
content: Qantas Airways Ltd. said customer data stolen during a cyber incident in July has been released online, and that it's working with security experts and Australian authorities to determine the extent of the exposure.

title: OBC Man Made To Wash Brahmin's Feet, Drink Water To "Atone" For Insult
content: In a shocking incident of caste-based discrimination, a young man in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district was allegedly forced to wash the feet of a Brahmin man and drink the water as a punishment for "insulting" him

title: BJP Names 3 Candidates For 4 Rajya Sabha Seats In J&K
content: The BJP on Sunday named three candidates, including its Jammu and Kashmir unit president Sat Pal Sharma, for the elections to four Rajya Sabha seats in the Union Territory scheduled for October 24.

title: Karnataka to appoint three Information Commissioners soon
content: CM is said to have finalised the names of former IAS officer Richard Vincent D’Souza, journalists Venkat Singh, and former journalist and currently officer on special duty to Legislative Council Chairman Basavaraj Horatti, Mahesh Valvekar.

title: Kaziranga Director becomes first Indian to receive IUCN award for innovation in national parks
content: Sonali Ghosh was awarded along with Ecuador’s politician-environmentalist, Roque Simón Sevilla Larrea, in Abu Dhabi

title: Karnataka DCM D.K. Shivakumar alleges NDA government of eroding, undermining transparency under RTI Act since 2014

title: Zubeen Garg's close associate Arun appears before CID

title: Female students staying in hostels must adhere to rules, mustn’t venture out late at night: Mamata
content: Students staying in hostels, especially those who have come to West Bengal to study from outside the State, are expected to follow the rules of the hostels, says West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee

title: Operation Blue Star a mistake, Indira Gandhi paid for it with her life: Chidambaram
content: Operation Blue Star was a military operation held between June 1-10, 1984, to remove Damdami Taksal leader Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale and his militants from the Golden Temple in Amritsar

title: SBI aims to enhance gender diversity, increase female workforce to 30% by 2030
content: The bank is taking measures to bridge the gap and achieve its medium-term goal of 30% women in its workforce, says Kishore Kumar Poludasu

title: Landslip damages several commercial structures in J&K’s Udhampur
content: The landslip struck Narsoo market in the Somroli area along the Jammu-Srinagar national highway around 11.30 am, resulting in damage to a recently opened hotel building and a couple of shops, says officials.

title: Seat-sharing in the INDIA bloc may have to wait as Lalu Prasad Yadav, Tejashwi Yadav leave for Delhi

content: The Rajarajeshwari Nagar MLA gatecrashed the event and launched a tirade against Mr. Shivakumar as well as the Greater Bengaluru Authority chief commissioner for failing to invite elected representatives or include their photos in the banners.

content: The Directorate of Enforcement seizes ₹45 lakh cash in raids linked to South Dum Dum Municipality recruitment scandal in West Bengal

content: Delhi High Court upholds custody decision based on mother’s neglect and abandonment, not solely on adultery allegations

content: The wild animal, spotted in Channarayapatna town on October 11 morning, ran helter-skelter, injuring a woman and damaging a car and a few two-wheelers.

content: Though the driver of the bus said that a container vehicle stopped suddenly in front of the bus, the passengers alleged that the driver’s drowsiness was the cause of the accident

title: Allahabad HC asks Google, Meta to remove 'objectionable' videos against Rambhadracharya
content: The court instructed the petitioners to provide the relevant URL links to the social media companies to facilitate the removal process. The next hearing in the case has been scheduled for November 11

title: Bumpy road to citizenship
content: The September 1 notification of the Union Ministry of Home Affairs, eliminating the element of criminality on undocumented or overstaying Sri Lankan Tamil refugees, offers hope to those longing for Indian citizenship. However, the notification has not explicitly stated that the refugees will no longer be considered illegal migrants. Meanwhile, the Tamil Nadu government continues measures to enhance the quality of life of the refugees. T. Ramakrishnan analyses issues and problems faced by the refugees in the State

title: Overcoming U.S. tariffs, the U.P. way
content: Uttar Pradesh has introduced a range of financial schemes under the new Export Promotion Policy 2025–30 to support exporters impacted by tariffs and to strengthen their presence in new markets such as Europe and Asia; these schemes provide wider and more practical assistance than before

title: “Biggest joke in the history”, says Uddhav Thackeray during the rally opposing govt’s relief package for farmers

title: YSRCP politicising Ambedkar statue desecration case, says A.P. Home Minister

title: Malappuram municipality clears 2-decade-old dump

title: Jay Dholakia, son of former BJD Minister, joins BJP

title:
A.P. govt. aims to create 1 lakh entrepreneurs 
from MEPMA, DWCRA groups, says CM

content: The development will include infrastructure such as guard rooms, ramps, repair yards, auction halls, sewage treatment facilities, IoT-based monitoring, satellite communication, and cybersecurity measures

title: Take up rainwater harvesting to ensure long-term water security in villages, says Stalin at gram sabha meeting
content: He advised local body representatives to ensure basic services such as water supply and electricity are not affected during rain and to form committees comprising social groups and local residents to plan in advance for the monsoon

title: Art forms nurtured Tamil language, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: The Dravidian movement has promoted Tamil music, writing, and theatre; it enriched the language on public platforms and reformed society, says Stalin while conferring Kalaimamani awards; he urges artists from the State to spread Tamil art forms and culture throughout the world

title: Karnataka Social and Educational Survey: Digital divide leaves senior enumerators struggling
content: While younger enumerators are able to navigate tech issues more easily, senior enumerators lament that they have limited familiarity with digital systems

title: With oral morphine solution inaccessible in districts, hundreds come to Kidwai every month
content: It has been over 10 years since Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985, was amended in 2014 to streamline the process for medical use of oral morphine and its access to those in need

title: U.S. Ambassador-designate Sergio Gor in Delhi, meets PM Modi, Jaishankar, Doval, and Misri

title: Brewers edge Cubs to make first NLCS since 2018
content: The Milwaukee Brewers outlasted the Chicago Cubs in Game 5 of the NLDS on Saturday night at American Family Field. They will now face the Los Angeles Dodgers, a team they went 6-0 against in the regular season, in the NLCS beginning on Monday night.

title: 'Not just one-hit wonder': Indiana upsets Oregon
content: Indiana remained undefeated with a 30-20 win over No. 3 Oregon. The win snapped a record streak of losses to AP top-five opponents.

title: Allar injured, out for year as PSU's skid hits 3
content: Penn State quarterback Drew Allar, who left the Nittany Lions' stunning 22-21 loss to Northwestern on Saturday, is out for the season, coach James Franklin said in his postgame media availability, not long after his reeling team fell to 3-3.

content: a 25-year-old private firm employee has been arrested under the protection of children from sexual offences (POCSO) . a weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health .

title: NHM staff await pending salaries, warn of protest if dues not cleared before Deepavali
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Woods has another procedure on lower back
content: Tiger Woods went through seventh back surgery to replace a disk in his lower back . it was his second surgery of the year -- he had a procedure in march after rupturing his left Achilles tendon . woods said he consulted doctors and surgeons after experiencing pain and mobility issues .

title: Sources eye bevy of NFL trades before deadline
content: the three NFL trades completed this week are expected to be a sign of things to come ahead of the league's Nov. 4 trade deadline . the list of trade candidates that executives and coaches believe could be available in the next few weeks features multiple high-profile players .

title: 'Have other options if ... ': Afghanistan warns Pak amid deadly border clash
content: Afghanistan's Foreign Minister warned of "other options" if peace talks with Pakistan fail, following intense border clashes. Kabul claims retaliatory operations achieved objectives with no civilian harm, accusing "elements in Pakistan" of seeking instability. Pakistan, however, labelled the strikes "unprovoked" and a "blatant violation of international laws."

title: Bihar polls: All eyes on seat-sharing deal; what's delaying INDIA bloc’s announcement?
content: Bihar's political landscape is buzzing with seat-sharing talks for the upcoming elections. While the NDA appears close to finalizing its allocations, the INDIA bloc faces continued uncertainty, particularly between the RJD and Congress.  Discussions are ongoing, with leaders heading to Delhi to resolve the deadlock and finalize candidate lists soon.

title: US tech company that faced China's 'anger' hours before Trump announced 100% tariffs
content: Escalating US-China trade tensions saw President Trump announce a 100% tariff on Chinese imports, effective November 1. In response, China launched an antitrust probe into US chip giant Qualcomm over its acquisition of Autotalks. This move, alongside other retaliatory measures targeting US interests, signals a significant escalation in the ongoing trade dispute.

title: 'Was working to rebuild terror infra': IDF eliminates Hezbollah operative - Video
content: Israeli forces conducted drone strikes in southern Lebanon, eliminating a Hezbollah operative involved in rebuilding the group's military infrastructure. An engineering vehicle was also targeted. These actions occur amidst escalating border tensions. Meanwhile, in Gaza, hundreds of thousands have returned to northern areas post-Israeli troop withdrawal, with a ceasefire and hostage release deal nearing finalization at an upcoming Egypt summit.

title: Bihar shocker: Man burns wife alive; wanted to marry lover
content: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly burnt alive by her husband in Nalanda district, with her family claiming he wanted to remarry his girlfriend. The accused husband and his parents fled the village after the incident. Police are conducting raids to apprehend the suspects.

title: Trump’s China tariffs: Billions wiped out of crypto market; biggest single-day fall
content: Bitcoin experienced a significant 8.4% drop, leading a $19 billion market wipeout. This downturn was triggered by President Trump's escalation of the US-China trade war, including new tariffs and export controls. The crypto market saw massive liquidations, with over 1.6 million traders affected, raising concerns about broader market contagion.

title: 'No deliberate exclusion': Muttaqi holds another presser; women journos present
content: Taliban's Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi addressed a press conference in Delhi with both male and female journalists present, following criticism for excluding women from a previous event. Muttaqi stated the earlier exclusion was due to short notice, not deliberate intent. This visit marks the first by a senior Taliban minister to India since the group's takeover.

title: Mutiny in Madagascar: Army unit claims control of military; president says coup under way
content: A mutinied army unit in Madagascar, CAPSAT, announced it has taken control of the military, challenging President Rajoelina's authority. This development follows weeks of anti-government protests fueled by shortages, with CAPSAT officers refusing to fire on demonstrators. The group's statement asserts all military orders will now come from their headquarters, escalating the political crisis.

title: IND vs WI | Gill takes unbelievable diving catch - Watch
content: Shubman Gill's spectacular diving catch ignited India's charge on Day 3 of the second Test against West Indies. Following a dominant bowling performance led by Kuldeep Yadav's five-wicket haul, India enforced the follow-on. The West Indies, struggling at 35 for 2 at tea, face a daunting task to avoid defeat.

title: Microsoft engineer quits after 13 years; sends resignation email to employees
content: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: MBBS student rape case: Survivor’s father alleges threat in Bengal
content: Three individuals have been arrested in connection with the gang rape of a medical student in West Bengal's Paschim Bardhaman district. The survivor, who has recorded her statement, is on bedrest and her father has requested to move her to Odisha for safety. The incident has sparked political tension and calls for swift justice.

title: Ayesha Curry’s marriage confession sparks backlash as NFL star Cam Newton steps in
content: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, faced fan backlash for her candid remarks about not initially wanting marriage or children. Despite criticism, she received support from figures like Cam Newton, who praised her honesty.  Others, including Gilbert Arenas and Stephen himself, have rallied behind her, highlighting the misunderstanding of her sentiments.

title: Jaz Elle’s one-word reply melts hearts on Agassi’s iconic style
content: Tennis icon Andre Agassi, fresh off leading Team World to victory at the 2025 Laver Cup, delighted fans with a throwback post of his iconic 80s and 90s fashion. His daughter, Jaz Elle Agassi, praised his "Majestic" style. Agassi also shared his competitive spirit as captain, calling the win a "special week."

title: 'She’s really scared': Taylor Swift’s behavior leaves Blake Lively worried about future
content: Blake Lively is reportedly anxious about her career following a supposed rift with close friend Taylor Swift. Sources suggest Lively fears Swift's significant influence in Hollywood could impact her professional future. Despite attempts to reconcile, Lively is said to be struggling with the silence from Swift, who has yet to address the alleged fallout publicly.

title: Silent layoffs surge in Indian IT; why it’s happening; subtle signs to watch now
content: Indian IT firms are undergoing major workforce shifts in 2025. Over 50,000 tech jobs face potential cuts as companies integrate AI and automation. Major players like TCS, Infosys, and Wipro are restructuring teams. This trend reflects evolving skill demands and global economic pressures. Employees are experiencing attrition, contract non-renewals, and silent layoffs.

title: Watch: Rs 30-lakh gold-plated urn stolen from Delhi temple
content: A gold-plated urn, valued at Rs 30 lakh, was stolen from the spire of a Jain temple in Jyoti Nagar, North East Delhi. CCTV footage revealed an unidentified man scaling the temple roof using electric wires to access the spire and remove the urn. A case has been registered following the incident.

title: Shawshank-style heist: How a murder accused tricked Azamgarh jail officials; siphoned Rs 30L
content: A murder accused in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh jail masterminded a Rs 30 lakh fraud, siphoning funds from the jail's account after obtaining a chequebook on bail.  He, along with a fellow inmate, a senior assistant, and a watchman, forged signatures to transfer the money. The scheme unraveled after the jail superintendent noticed suspicious withdrawals.

title: Lip balm on the field! KL Rahul vs Shubman Gill banter goes viral - WATCH
content: The India vs West Indies second Test in Delhi was filled with on-field banter, including a humorous moment with KL Rahul applying lip balm and Shubman Gill joining in. Gill, in his second Test as captain, continued his impressive form by scoring a blistering century, his fifth as skipper.

title: IND vs WI | Kuldeep clinches stunning five-for; fastest in world to achieve rare feat
content: Kuldeep Yadav's exceptional 5-wicket haul, his fifth in Tests, propelled India to a commanding position against West Indies. With a significant lead, India enforced the follow-on, leaving the visitors with a daunting task to extend the match.  Kuldeep's spell, also saw him become the owner of the joint-most five-wicket hauls in cricket for a left arm wrist spinner.

title: No can, no beer! Aluminium tin crisis brews trouble; Indian brewers warn of Rs 1,300cr revenue loss
content: India's beer industry faces a critical aluminium can shortage, threatening supply and government revenue. The Brewers Association of India (BAI) is urging for relaxed quality control norms and deferred import certifications to avert significant losses. Domestic suppliers cannot meet demand for at least a year, impacting breweries and allied sectors.

title: Afghanistan foreign minister Amir Khan Muttaqi's visit to Agra cancelled
content: Afghanistan's Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi's planned visit to Agra on Sunday has been cancelled, with official sources confirming the decision without specifying a reason. Muttaqi was scheduled to visit the Taj Mahal, with elaborate security arrangements in place for the high-profile trip. The visit held significance amid strained India-Pakistan relations.

title: 'Hurt, shaken': Kharge writes to wife of Haryana IPS officer who died by suicide
content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge expressed deep sorrow over the suicide of Haryana IPS officer V.Y. Puran Kumar, attributing it to social prejudices and systemic inequities. Kumar's suicide note named 16 senior IAS and IPS officers, alleging harassment. The Haryana government has initiated reshuffles in police leadership amid growing outrage and demands for accountability.

title: 'Don't want to fight but ...': China blasts US over extra 100% tariff; calls out 'double standards'
content: The trade war between the United States and China has intensified. Washington imposed a 100% tariff on Chinese goods. Beijing accused the US of double standards and warned of consequences. China also introduced new controls on rare earth exports. These actions have severely damaged trade relations and prospects for dialogue between the two nations.

title: 'Calm my heart': Prithvi Shaw's emotional message; Ranji season starts October 9
content: Prithvi Shaw is gearing up for the Ranji Trophy season with a renewed focus, evident in his reflective Instagram post. Having moved to Maharashtra from Mumbai, he's part of the squad aiming for a strong campaign. Shaw's recent form, including a century in a warm-up match, and his apology for an on-field incident signal a determined approach to revive his red-ball career.

title: Russian tourist confronts kids littering; Rijiju reacts to video
content: A Russian tourist's viral video shows her confronting Indian children for littering, urging them to clean up their country. The incident, which gained attention from Union Minister Kiren Rijiju, sparked a debate on civic sense in India. Social media reactions highlighted the need for better public hygiene and parental guidance.

title: IND vs WI | 'Don't beat our bowlers that bad!'; Lara pleads with Yashasvi Jaiswal
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's brilliant 175 against West Indies showcased maturity, featuring 22 boundaries.  The young opener, now among the youngest to achieve five 150+ scores before 24, shared a lighthearted moment with Brian Lara. Jaiswal emphasized his team-first approach, aiming to convert starts into big scores and praising partnerships for maintaining pressure.

title: Can drinking barley water with lemon juice help in rapid weight loss
content: Many people are health conscious and seek natural ways to manage weight. Barley water, made from the grain 'jau', is a healthy option. It helps in weight loss by promoting fullness and aiding digestion. This drink also offers benefits like lowering cholesterol and controlling blood sugar. It is rich in vitamins and antioxidants.

title: West Bengal: 3 held in medical student gang-rape case
content: Authorities apprehended three individuals in connection with the alleged gang rape of a medical student in West Bengal's Paschim Bardhaman district. The victim, a second-year student, was reportedly attacked outside a private college campus. The incident has ignited political debate, with Odisha's Chief Minister urging swift action from his West Bengal counterpart.

title: Bill & Hillary Clinton celebrates 50 years of marriage, share unseen photos
content: Bill and Hillary Clinton celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary with touching tributes on X, reflecting on their enduring partnership. While many offered congratulations, the posts also sparked online debate, with some users recalling past controversies and noting the disabling of comments. The couple's milestone has drawn a range of public reactions.

title: Supported Israel? Why Maria Machado is facing backlash; old posts resurface
content: Nobel Peace Prize winner Maria Corina Machado faced criticism for past X posts supporting Israel's actions in Gaza and urging Argentina and Israel to dismantle Venezuela's regime. Machado, an industrial engineer from an upper-class background, won the opposition primary in 2023 but was barred from public office, leading her to go into hiding.

title: Watch: Trump’s granddaughter asks him, 'Is there a dream you’re chasing?'
content: During a golf outing, President Trump was asked by his granddaughter, Kai, if he still had dreams to chase. Trump humorously compared her questions to a TV interview before stating that becoming president was the dream, and now he dreams of being a great one.

title: Injury scare? Sai Sudharsan off the field on Day 3; latest on India batter
content: Indian batter Sai Sudharsan sat out Day 3 of the second Test against West Indies as a precaution after an impact injury on Day 2.  The BCCI Medical Team confirmed he is "doing fine" following a spectacular short-leg catch. Sudharsan had earlier contributed a valuable 87 runs to India's dominant first innings.

title: 'Dekho Starc saamne khada hai': Fans give Rohit Sharma bizarre motivation - watch
content: Former India captain Rohit Sharma honed his skills at Mumbai's Shivaji Park for nearly two hours, practicing against pace and spin. Fans urged him to lead India to the 2027 World Cup victory, highlighting his crucial role. Sharma is set to return to international cricket for the upcoming ODI series against Australia. A bizarre motivation call for the batter left fans in splits.

title: Novak Djokovic reveals the truth about his rivalry and rift with Rafael Nadal
content: Novak Djokovic revealed he will never be friends with Rafael Nadal, despite immense respect, stating their intense rivalry made closeness impossible. He acknowledged Nadal and Roger Federer significantly shaped his career, fostering a unique bond through shared competition. Djokovic's comments followed a surprising Shanghai Masters exit to a low-ranked opponent.

title: IND vs WI: Granddaddy hundreds! Gavaskar urges Jaiswal to keep scoring big
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's brilliant 175 against West Indies at Delhi showcased his class, though a mix-up ended his innings prematurely. This fifth 150+ score before 24 places him with Graeme Smith.  Legend Sunil Gavaskar humorously urged him to score 'granddaddy hundreds,' highlighting Jaiswal's burgeoning potential and consistency.

title: US doctor explains how Malaika Arora’s morning drink helps bloating and digestion
content: Malaika Arora starts her day by preparing a traditional drink from jeera and ajwain seeds that she soaks overnight, before consuming in the morning. The mixture occasionally includes saunf (fennel seeds) as an additional ingredient. The three ingredients serve as "kitchen doctors" in Indian homes, because they provide health benefits to people through their common usage in kitchens

title: 'I'll dismiss him in 3–6 balls': Pakistan fast bowler's challenge to Abhishek Sharma
content: Pakistan pacer Ihsanullah has boldly challenged India's star batter Abhishek Sharma, claiming he can dismiss him within six balls. Ihsanullah, known for his express pace, believes his bowling will trouble the in-form left-hander. Sharma, meanwhile, continues his meteoric rise, impressing legends like Brian Lara with his explosive batting.

title: US school campus shooting: At least 4 dead, 12 injured in Mississippi
content: Tragedy struck Leland, Mississippi, early Saturday as a shooting during homecoming weekend claimed four lives and injured at least twelve. Crowds gathered on the main street for the high school festivities when the violence erupted. Authorities are actively investigating the incident, with the Mississippi Bureau of Investigation assisting local efforts.

title: 'Removed brain with spoon': NYC teen beheads mom’s BF; mother blames system
content: A shocking incident unfolded in Staten Island where a mother recounted her son's alleged brutal killing of her boyfriend. The young man, reportedly battling mental illness, is accused of a horrific act. His mother believes his medical care was mishandled, leading to this tragedy. Authorities are investigating the disturbing details of the crime scene.

title: 'Man, he loves football. You can feel it': How Deebo became an instant hit in D.C.
content: quarterback Jayden Daniels and receiver Deebo Samuel performed their skit in the end zone . Daniels connected with Samuel on a fourth-and-goal from the 8-yard line in the win over the los Angeles Chargers . it's one reason why Samuel is off to such a great start in his first season with Washington .

title: 'Done unintentionally': Taliban on excluding women journalists from Muttaqi meet
content: a growing controversy over absence of women journalists from a press meet of visiting Afghan foreign minister . amir Khan Muttaqi was given the honorary title 'the honourary title' by the Taliban . the taliban head of political office has denied allegations that women scribes were deliberately kept out .
